div.p: The Board of Regents and the New York State Education Department (NYSED) are providing information and guidance for P-12 schools, colleges and universities, licensed professionals, adult education programs, and NYSED employees in response to the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19).

div.div: P-12 school guidance and resources are available from several sources, including NYSED, the U.S. Department of Education, the NYS Department of Health, the CDC, and the NYS Center for School Health.
Additional guidance is available for colleges and universities, licensed professionals, adult education programs, and NYSED employees.

NYSED launched a website featuring continuity of learning resources (technology- or non-technology-based) to provide districts and teachers with increased options to keep students engaged in learning.
All State Education Department buildings are temporarily closed to the public, including the State Museum, State Library, and State Archives.

span.a: NYSED Issues Guidance on Graduation and Course Requirement Changes

div.div: NYSED announced the cancellation of the June 2020 administration of Regents Exams and released updated graduation guidance.

span.a: Regents Act on Emergency Regulations to Ease the Burdens on Educators, Students and Professionals

div.div: The series of amendments address numerous issues resulting from the interruptions districts, institutions of higher education and licensed...

span.a: NYSED and State Museum Announce Expanded Learning Resources for Educators and Parents

div.div: The State Museum is offering behind the scenes virtual field trips, and we have added dozens of new options on our Continuity of Learning website.

span.a: Statement From Chancellor Rosa and Interim Commissioner Tahoe on the Enacted State Budget

div.div: The Board of Regents and the Department will do everything in our power to ease the uncertainty that this budget will place on New York’s students,...

span.a: NYSED Issues Guidance on Graduation and Course Requirement Changes

div.div: NYSED announced the cancellation of the June 2020 administration of Regents Exams and released updated graduation guidance.

img.alt: Emergency Regulations as a Result of COVID-19

span.a: Regents Act on Emergency Regulations to Ease the Burdens on Educators, Students and Professionals

div.div: The series of amendments address numerous issues resulting from the interruptions districts, institutions of higher education and licensed professionals are experiencing caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

span.a: NYSED and State Museum Announce Expanded Learning Resources for Educators and Parents

div.div: The State Museum is offering behind the scenes virtual field trips, and we have added dozens of new options on our Continuity of Learning website.
